title: Globbing
content:
What is globbing?

Globs are wildcard patterns expanded by the shell before the command runs.

  • *: any characters
  • ?: exactly one character
  • [abc]: one of a/b/c
cd ~/unix-cli-practice
mkdir -p glob-demo
cd glob-demo
touch a1.txt a2.txt b1.txt notes.md
ls *.txt
ls ?.txt 2>/dev/null || true
ls [ab]*.txt

Important

Globs are expanded by the shell, not by the program. If you need a literal *, quote it.

echo "*"   # prints literal *
